meanings.definition: To fly or rise high in the air.
meanings.sent1: The eagle soars gracefully above the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The bird soars effortlessly through the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent3: The kite soars so high that it almost touches the clouds!
meanings.sent4: Her spirit soars like a bird set free from its cage.
meanings.sent5: The airplane soars through the atmosphere with incredible speed.

meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in amount or value.
meanings.sent1: The stock price soars after the positive earnings report.
meanings.sent2: The demand for the new product soars as customers rave about its quality.
meanings.sent3: The popularity of the band soars to new heights after their hit song goes viral.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement soars when she receives the news of her promotion.
meanings.sent5: The temperature soars as the summer sun beats down on the city.

meanings.definition: To rise or ascend to a great height.
meanings.sent1: The hot air balloon soars above the countryside, offering a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent2: The rocket soars into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.
meanings.sent3: The price of the rare painting soars to astronomical levels at the auction.
meanings.sent4: His ambition soars as he sets his sights on achieving his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The skyscraper soars into the sky, dominating the city skyline.
